abstract: JPMorgan Chase was in talks for a deal that would quintuple its offer for Bear Stearns in an effort to pacify Bear shareholders, according to people involved in the discussions.
snippet: JPMorgan Chase was in talks for a deal that would quintuple its offer for Bear Stearns in an effort to pacify Bear shareholders, according to people involved in the discussions.
lead_paragraph: JPMorgan Chase was in talks on Sunday night for a deal that would quintuple its offer for Bear Stearns, the beleaguered investment bank, in an effort to pacify angry Bear shareholders, according to people involved in the negotiations.

headline.main: JPMorgan in Negotiations to Raise Bear Stearns Bid
headline.print_headline: JPMorgan in Negotiations To Raise Bear Stearns Bid

abstract: The offer is intended to win over angry shareholders in Bear who vowed to fight the original fire-sale deal.
snippet: The offer is intended to win over angry shareholders in Bear who vowed to fight the original fire-sale deal.
lead_paragraph: JPMorgan Chase raised its offer for Bear Stearns, the beleaguered investment bank, to $10 a share Monday morning in an effort to pacify angry Bear shareholders.

headline.main: JPMorgan Raises Bid for Bear Stearns to $10 a Share
headline.print_headline: JPMorgan in Negotiations Raise Bear Stearns Bid

abstract: JPMorgan Chase was in talks on Sunday night for a deal that would quintuple its offer for Bear Stearns, the beleaguered investment bank, in an effort to pacify angry Bear shareholders, the New York Times reported citing people involved in the negotiations.
lead_paragraph: JPMorgan Chase was in talks on Sunday night for a deal that would quintuple its offer for Bear Stearns, the beleaguered investment bank, in an effort to pacify angry Bear shareholders, the New York Times reported citing people involved in the negotiations.

headline.main: JPMorgan in Talks to Raise Bear Stearns Bid

abstract: JPMorgan was last week rushing to reassure hedge fund clients of Bear Stearns‘ prime brokerage of its commitment to the business to prevent an exodus of assets before the integration, according to Financial News.
lead_paragraph: JPMorgan was last week rushing to reassure hedge fund clients of Bear Stearns‘ prime brokerage of its commitment to the business to prevent an exodus of assets before the integration, according to Financial News.

headline.main: Funds Said to Desert Bear Stearns

abstract: In the week or so since the Federal Reserve Bank of New York pushed Bear Stearns into the arms of JPMorgan Chase, there has been much buzz about why the deal went down precisely as it did.
lead_paragraph: In the week or so since the Federal Reserve Bank of New York pushed Bear Stearns into the arms of JPMorgan Chase, there has been much buzz about why the deal went down precisely as it did.

abstract: Monday brought a rare bit of good news for Bear Stearns‘ beleaguered shareholders: The New York Times reported that JPMorgan Chase was in talks over the weekend to raise its bid for Bear to $10 per share from $2 per share.
lead_paragraph: Monday brought a rare bit of good news for Bear Stearns‘ beleaguered shareholders: The New York Times reported that JPMorgan Chase was in talks over the weekend to raise its bid for Bear to $10 per share from $2 per share.

headline.main: CNBC Video: Chase’s Talks to Raise Bear Bid

abstract: It’s official: JPMorgan Chase and Bear Stearns have announced new terms for their merger deal, confirming Monday’s report in The New York Times. The new agreement raises JPMorgan’s offer for Bear to $10 per share in JPMorgan’s stock, up from $2 per share, quintupling the payout for shareholders of Bear, the securities firm that nearly collapsed earlier this month amid concerns about its liquidity.
lead_paragraph: It’s official: JPMorgan Chase and Bear Stearns have announced new terms for their merger deal, confirming Monday’s report in The New York Times. The new agreement raises JPMorgan’s offer for Bear to $10 per share in JPMorgan’s stock, up from $2 per share, quintupling the payout for shareholders of Bear, the securities firm that nearly collapsed earlier this month amid concerns about its liquidity.

headline.main: JPMorgan Raises Bear Bid to $10 Per Share

abstract: In scrambling to patch the mistakes in their previous deal with Bear Stearns, JPMorgan and its attorneys at Wachtell Lipton Rosen & Katz may have put themselves in a newly precarious position.
lead_paragraph: In scrambling to patch the mistakes in their previous deal with Bear Stearns, JPMorgan and its attorneys at Wachtell Lipton Rosen & Katz may have put themselves in a newly precarious position.

abstract: Already, Bear Stearns has posted to its Web site all of the amended agreements in connection with its price renegotiation. (You can read the amended merger agreement here and the amended guarantee agreement here, both as PDFs.)
